thread.title: Why Jordan Henderson is the king of passing in the Premier League
thread.title_full: Why Jordan Henderson is the king of passing in the Premier League

author: Jon Moody
title: Why Jordan Henderson is the king of passing in the Premier League

organizations.name: getty images) share get liverpool fc

text:
Why Jordan Henderson is the king of passing in the Premier League Forget about your Ozils and your Matas - the league's pass master is plying his trade at Anfield Share (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
There was a time when Jordan Henderson was unfairly a figure of fun among football fans. 
Many said he'd be end up being yet another in the long list of big money flops at Liverpool when he joined the club back in the summer of 2011 - but how wrong they've proved to be. 
The England international is now club captain at Anfield and is an integral part of the team's set-up under Jurgen Klopp. 
While some of his traits may still irritate certain ex-players , it speaks volumes that his latest injury is such a blow - ruling him out of their next Premier League game against Leicester. (Photo: Liverpool FC) 
And when you take a look at these stats, it's clear to see why. 
When it comes to passing in the Premier League, NOBODY beats Jordan Henderson. 
He's made a ridiculous 2,057 passes so far this season, a whopping 271 more than his nearest rival, Paul Pogba: Most passes in the Premier League 
The rest of the top 10 is mostly made up of the type of player you'd expect - deep-lying midfielders responsible for spraying the ball around and getting it up the pitch, such as N'Golo Kante and Victor Wanyama. (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
With that in mind, how does he shape up among his competition when it comes to getting the ball into the danger zone? 
Again, the stats show the 26-year-old is head and shoulders above everyone else. (Photo: John Powell) 
Of his huge number of passes, 324 have been made into the final third of the pitch - which is 34 more than Pogba, who is again second to the Reds' skipper. Most passes into the final third in the Premier League 
Fans of long-ball football - please take note of the third and fourth biggest passers in this particular list: Burnley keeper Tom Heaton and West Brom shot-stopper Ben Foster respectively. 
Who said long-ball was dead? (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
With James Milner the only other Liverpool player to feature in either of this top 10s, it's easy to see why fans may be apprehensive going into games with their skipper. At least these numbers will give you something to be happy about, Jordan... Like us on Facebook
